1.q_string:
In which of the following reactions does \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}\) act as a reducing agent?
(a) \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}+2 \mathrm{H}^{+}+2 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\)
(b) \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}-2 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{2}+2 \mathrm{H}^{+}\)
(c) \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}+2 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{H}^{-}\)
(d) \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}+2 \mathrm{OH}^{-}-2 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{2}+2 \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\)

q_option: bromine is oxidised and carbonate is reduced
bromine is reduced and water is oxidised
bromine is neither reduced nor oxidised
bromine is both reduced and oxidised

1.q_string: For the reaction between KMnO<sub>4</sub> and H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>, the number of electrons transferred per mole of H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> is

q_option: 1 mole of potassium permanganate oxidises 5 moles of the metal sulphite.
There is a net transfer of 5 electrons in the reaction.
20 mL of 0.5M KMnO<sub>4</sub> solution can neutralise 10 mL of 0.25 M metal sulphite.
50 mL of KMnO<sub>4</sub> can oxidise a 20 mL equimolar solution of the metal sulphite.
1.q_string:
Consider the reaction between potessium permanganate and a metal sulphite represented as follows
\(\mathrm{MnO}_{4}^{-}+\mathrm{SO}_{3}^{2-}+\mathrm{H}^{+} \rightarrow \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}+\mathrm{SO}_{4}^{2-}+\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\)
Which of the following options about the process is correct?
In standardisation of Na<sub>2</sub>S<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>, using K<sub>2</sub>Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub> by iodometry, the equivalent weight of K<sub>2</sub>Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub> is
150 ml of M/10 Ba(MnO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>2</sub> in acidic medium cannot completely oxidise

q_option: The resulting solution is alkaline in nature.
The equivalent weight of H<sub>3</sub>PO<sub>4</sub> is 49.
1 mole of H<sub>3</sub>PO<sub>4</sub> is completely neutralised by 1 mole of Ca(OH)<sub>2</sub>.
The reaction is neutralization as well as redox reaction.
1.q_string: For the reaction H3PO4 + Ca(OH)2 → CaHPO4 + 2H2O, which of the following statements is correct?

Consider the following reaction:
\(\mathrm{xMnO}_{4}^{-}+\mathrm{yC}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{4}^{2-}+\mathrm{zH}^{+} \rightarrow \mathrm{xMn}^{2+}+2 \mathrm{y} \mathrm{CO}_{2}+\frac{\mathrm{z}}{2} \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\)
The respective values of \(x, y\) and \(z\) in the reaction are

q_option: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion.
Both assertion and reason are true, but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion.
Assertion is true, but reason is false.
Both assertion and reason are false.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, a statement of assertion is given, followed by a corresponding statement of reason below it. Choose the correct option.
Assertion: Cu2+ and Cd2+ are separated by first adding KCN solution and then, passing H2S gas.
Reason: KCN reduces Cu2+ to Cu+ and forms a complex with it.
In which of the following compounds does oxygen have a +2 oxidation number?

The standard reduction potentials of \(C u^{2+} \mid C u\) and \(A g^{+} \mid A g\) electrodes are 0.337
and 0.799 volts respectively. Construct a galvanic cell using these electrodes so
that its standard emf is positive. For what concentration of \(A g^{+}\) will the emf of the
cell at \(25^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) be zero if concentration of \(\mathrm{Cu}^{2+}\) is \(0.01 \mathrm{M}\) ?

Given the following reaction determine  \(E_{\text {cell }}^{\circ}\) for the following reaction at standard conditions?
\[
M n_{(a q)}^{2+}+K_{(s)} \rightleftharpoons M n O_{2(s)}+K_{(a q)}
\]

q_option: Cl<sub>2</sub>, Zn, H<sub style="font-size:">2</sub>, Fe<sup style="font-size:">3</sup><sup style="font-size:">+</sup>
Cl<sub>2</sub>, Fe<sup style="font-size:">3+</sup>, Zn, H<sub style="font-size:">2</sub>
1.q_string: For \(\mathrm{Zn}^{2+} / \mathrm{Zn}=-0.76 \mathrm{V}, \mathrm{Cl}_{2} / \mathrm{Cl}^{-}=1.36 \mathrm{V}, \mathrm{H}^{+} / \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{H}_{2}=0 \mathrm{V}\) and \(\mathrm{Fe}^{3+} / \mathrm{Fe}^{2+}=0.77 \mathrm{V}\), the increasing order of strengths as a reducing agent is.

Given the following reaction determine \(\Delta G, K,\) and \(E_{\text {cell }}^{\circ}\) for the following reaction at standard conditions?
\begin{equation}M n_{(a q)}^{2+}+K_{(s)} \rightleftharpoons M n O_{2(s)}+K_{(a q)}\end{equation}
What is the oxidation number of Mn is \(\mathrm{KMnO}_{4}\) and of \(\mathrm{S}\) in \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{S}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3} ?\)
